snippet: Jo-Wilfried Tsonga became the first Frenchman to win the Rogers Cup in the Open Era and became the first player to defeat four straight top-10 opponents at a Masters 1000 tournament since 2002.
abstract: Jo-Wilfried Tsonga captures tennis title and a bit of history, defeating Roger Federer in straight sets to become the first Frenchman to win the Rogers Cup in the Open Era; Agnieszka Radwanska beats Venus Williams, to win the women’s title.
lead_paragraph: Jo-Wilfried Tsonga became the first Frenchman to win the Rogers Cup in the Open Era and became the first player to defeat four straight top-10 opponents at a Masters 1000 tournament since 2002.

headline.main: On Day of Several Firsts, Tsonga Captures Rogers Cup in Straight Sets Over Federer
headline.print_headline: On Day of Several Firsts, Tsonga Captures Rogers Cup in Straight Sets Over Federer
